questions.question: What ................... they wear to work?
questions.description: In the simple present tense, we make questions and negatives with do and does. Do is used with plural nouns and pronouns. Does is used with singular nouns and pronouns.

questions.question: She ……………. not talk much.
questions.description: In the simple present tense, we make questions and negatives with do and does. Do is used with plural nouns and pronouns. Does is used with singular nouns and pronouns.

questions.question: Where ................... he work?
questions.description: He is singular in number. Therefore, we use does with it.

questions.question: John .................. know much about sailing.
questions.description: John is singular. Therefore, we use does with it.

questions.question: I ..................... not have the time or patience to cook a proper meal.
questions.description: We use do with the first person singular pronoun I.

questions.question: I am too busy these days and I .................. manage to leave office on time.
questions.description: We use do with the first person singular pronoun I.

questions.question: ................... Susie come here often?
questions.description: Susie is singular. So we use does with it.

questions.question: .................... you find Berlin's weather cold?
questions.description: The second person pronoun you takes the auxiliary do.

questions.question: Raj .................... not smoke or drink.
questions.description: Raj is singular, so we use does with it.

questions.question: .................... she know what she is doing?
Why .................. they always get into trouble?
questions.description: They is plural, so we use the plural verb do with it.

questions.question: What .................... you like to watch on TV?
